intro: Ligeria pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf ligeria, is a small flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of only a few centimeters, with narrow, grass-like leaves and small yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
